source.ce09b665:
# Data wrangling


* The heart is one of the most important parts as it pumps blood around your body, delivering oxygen and nutrients to your cells and removing waste products. 
* Every day, the average human heart beats around 100,000 times, pumping 2,000 gallons of blood through the body. Inside your body there are 60,000 miles of blood vessels.
* A heart attack occurs when an artery supplying your heart with blood and oxygen becomes blocked.
* Fatty deposits build up over time, forming plaques in your heart's arteries. If a plaque ruptures, a blood clot can form and block your arteries, causing a heart attack.
